com.ausinformatics.overrun.client

Class ClientLibrary

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ausinformatics.overrun.client.ClientLibrary

  • public class ClientLibrary
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the manager of all things client. It is the main() entry point of the client, as well as providing all network communication. It also provides a ClientLibrary.ClientInterface that your class must implement if it intends to play the game

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  ClientLibrary.ClientInterface
      The client interface.

    • Field Summary

      Set ClientLibrary.echo_mode = true if you need to debug network traffic.

    • Field Detail

      • echo_mode

        public static boolean echo_mode
        Set ClientLibrary.echo_mode = true if you need to debug network traffic. Likely won't be needed by a client, but sometimes it's worth knowing what the server sends vs what you believe about what you're receiving

    • Constructor Detail

      • ClientLibrary

        protected ClientLibrary()

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static ClientLibrary getInstance()
        Returns the singleton instance of the ClientLibrary. This will be necessary if you intend to call functions like build(int cost) or similar

      • setName

        public void setName(java.lang.String name)
        This will ask the server to set your name. Names are sanitised to remove spaces and be at most 16 characters long.
        Parameters:
        name - Your name

      • setColour

        public void setColour(int r,
             int g,
             int b)
        This will ask the server to set the colour of your AI. For a given game you are not guaranteed to be exactly this colour (if two colours are considered 'too close'); in this case your colour will be used as a starting hint for the final game colour.
        Parameters:
        r - The r value of your colour, between 0 and 255.
        g - The g value of your colour, between 0 and 255.
        b - The b value of your colour, between 0 and 255.

      • move

        public void move(int uid,
        int move)
        This function asks the server to move one of your units. It may only be called from ClientLibrary.ClientInterface.clientDoTurn(). If you ask the server to move the same unit multiple times per turn, only the first request will be respected; the remainder will be ignored
        Parameters:
        uid - The Id of the unit you wish to move.
        move - The command you wish to issue (see the constants defined in ClientLibrary.ClientInterface.Constants)

      • build

        public void build(int cost)
        This function asks the server to build a unit. It may only be called from within ClientLibrary.ClientInterface.clientDoTurn(). You may only build one unit per turn; the last such request will be honoured and the remainder will be ignored.
        Parameters:
        cost - The amount of money you wish to spend on this unit. See getCost(int) and getCans(int)

      • getCost

        public int getCost(int cans)
        This function returns the cost to build a unit. It may be called at any time.
        Parameters:
        cans - The number of cans that the unit has
        Returns:
        The cost to build a unit with the given number of cans

      • getCans

        public int getCans(int value)
        This function returns the number of cans a unit will start with, given a cost. It may be called at any time.
        Parameters:
        value - The value you wish to spend on this unit
        Returns:
        The number of cans this unit will start with, given the value you wish to spend on it.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        The entry point of the client. You should not attempt to write your own main function!
